text:
Hi I'm Liv and I'm here with my friend, Kei,
from Asian Boss.

Today I'm asking the general public about
some of the stereotypes the Western women
have about Asian men.
Let's find out.

What do you think about Asian men. So what
sort of stereotypes have you got associated with them?
Let's start with the positives first.
Very smart.
Very driven.
Career focused, I guess.
Smart, motivated to succeed in like business.
Well dressed.
They are very nice boyfriends.

And they look after their girls and shower
them with gifts. So I guess that's a good thing.

May be a little shy, especially in clubs and
stuff.
But they are nice. They're really lovely.

I envision people in fancy cars smoking. Asian
guys in this fancy souped up car with the
cigarette hanging out of their mouth,
but they look really classy, still.

They all hang out in Karaoke bars and all
go to Asian restaurants and things like that.
I would say they keep to themselves.
Very good with maths.

I think they are quite good at science and
mathematics.

I don't ever find Asian men seedy or overly
flirtatious.
Always very polite and genuine.

Look actually, there are a few Asians at my
gym that are really hot.

Any negative stereotypes that are surrounding
Asian men.
You can be as honest as you want.

Fairly stuck in their ways. Very, sort of,
traditional.

Many of them are addicted to computer games,
I think.

And yeah a bit shy when it comes to talking
to women.

From my perspective it's usually the height
thing that people say.
I've heard that they have small penises.
About possibly their package

Do you think that stemmed from the media and
having watched movies and that sort of thing,
or other?

Probably more movies and just like making
a joke and everyone just caught onto the same
joke, I guess. I'm not really sure.

Yeah most likely on movies, jokes, a lot of
comedians.

In terms of Chinese or Asian actors or TV
personalities, celebrities, can you think of any?

Not that I can think of at the top of my head
now.
There is the guy on Hangover.
Jackie Chan.
There is another guy, Jet Li? He's hot.
Jackie Chan?
Jackie Chan.
Or Bruce Lee. Or is he a cricketer.
Yeah like the kung fu guy, what's his name?
Jackie Chan?
Yeah, Jackie Chan. I know that one but

otherwise I don't think there are many famous
Asian guys.
That Psy guy, that Korean guy.

You don't tend to see a lot of Asian actors
or celebrities.

Maybe like Asian celebrities that are within
Asian culture but not much in Western culture.
Thank you so much, Liv, for the interview.
What is your take on Asian stereotypes?

Obviously, Asians have a traditional stigma
attached to them in a Westernised society.

I believe, you know, being traditional and
well kept, groomed
having a great education is very important.

But I feel like Western women sort of take
that for granted and they might think:

"Ok he's a little bit of an introvert" as
opposed to "wow, this man is really fantastic."
I feel like maybe there should be more media attached in a positive way to the traditional Asian men.

So basically, by having more Asian role models
that you could look up to,
you could make a change then.

Liv is an awesome fashion stylist. Please
follow her on Instagram and look at her YouTube
channel, too.

It's in the description box below. Also don't
forget to subscribe to Asian Boss.
See you next time.
